name: Vietnamese Mustard Green Soup with Shrimp Balls (Canh Cải Bẹ Xanh Nấu Tôm Băm)
description: An easy and comforting Vietnamese soup side dish of ground shrimp and mustard greens. Cooks up in about 5 minutes. Serve with steamed rice and a protein side dish for a complete meal.
keywords: canh cải bẹ xanh nấu tôm băm, canh cai be xanh nau tom bam, canh cai be xanh nau tom, canh cai be xanh recipe, canh tom recipe, canh cai be xanh nau tom bam recipe, canh cai be xanh nau tom recipe, chinese mustard green, vietnamese mustard green, ground shrimp soup, vietnamese soup with shrimp, vietnamese mustard green soup, how to make mustard green soup, vietnamese mustard green soup recipe, vietnamese mustard green and shrimp recipe, soup with mustard green, soup with shrimp, vietnamese home cooking recipes, vietnamese home cooking recipe, cai be xanh, what is mustard greens, what is chinese mustard greens, what are chinese mustard greens, what are mustard greens, what are vietnamese mustard greens, how to make shrimp balls bouncy, how to make meatballs bouncy, springy shrimp balls, how to make springy shrimp balls, mustard green soup with shrimp balls, mustard green soup with shrimp, mustard green soup with shrimp ball recipe, mustard green soup with shrimp recipe, vietnamese cuisine

video.name: Mustard Green with Shrimp Balls (Canh Cai Be Xanh Nau Tom Bam)
video.description: Mustard Green with Shrimp Balls (Canh Cai Be Xanh Nau Tom Bam)

recipeIngredient: 10 oz Chinese mustard greens (cut into bite-size pieces)
recipeInstructions: Mince shrimp into a paste with a mortar and pestle, large meat cleaver, or food processor. Add salt, sugar, bouillon powder, ground black pepper, and tapioca starch. Mix until combined and set aside. Alternatively, if you are feeling lazy, leave shrimp whole, season and leave out tapioca starch.

In a medium-size stock pot, heat oil on medium-high. Add garlic and saute until fragrant (a few seconds). Add water slowly to the stock pot. When the pot comes to a boil, scoop shrimp paste into small balls using two spoons then drop it into the hot water. Cook for 3 minutes on a medium-low simmer. Balls will float when they are cooked all the way through.
Add mustard green. Cook for 2 minutes. Season soup to taste with salt, fish sauce, sugar, and chicken bouillon powder. Garnish with a sprinkle of ground black pepper and serve.
